snippet: Relief trucks delivered food to Daraya, a town outside Damascus, but residents reported that it was soon bombed by the Syrian military.
abstract: Relief convoy delivers aid for first time in four years to rebel-held Daraya, Syria, but bombing by Syrian military aircraft disrupts distribution of supplies; bombing illustrates conflicting messages given by Pres Bashar al-Assad, who has promised to allow aid into areas outside government control.

byline.original: By HWAIDA SAAD and RICK GLADSTONE
byline.contributor: Hwaida Saad reported from Beirut, and Rick Gladstone from New York. Somini Sengupta contributed reporting from the United Nations.

lead_paragraph: Relief trucks delivered food to Daraya, a town outside Damascus, but residents reported that it was soon bombed by the Syrian military.

headline.main: Besieged Syrian Town Gets First Food Aid Since 2012, Then Gets Bombed
headline.print_headline: Syrian Bombing Disrupts Distribution of Food Aid
